title: Slightly extend help diagnostic for immediately invoked closure

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: [link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=3502f70964f7f5e0955eeb83e22286ca)

```rust
fn main() {
    println!("{}", || 123 ());
}
```

The current output is:

```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[[E0618]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0618): expected function, found `{integer}`
 --> src/main.rs:2:23
  |
2 |     println!("{}", || 123 ());
  |                       ^^^---
  |                       |
  |                       call expression requires function

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0618`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should suggest adding parentheses around the closure before calling it, since that suggestion is already present if the return value of the closure is wrapped in braces, as shown below.


```rust
fn main() {
    println!("{}", || { 123 } ());
}
```

Output with help suggestion:

```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[[E0618]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0618): expected function, found `{integer}`
 --> src/main.rs:2:23
  |
2 |     println!("{}", || { 123 } ());
  |                       ^^^^^^^---
  |                       |
  |                       call expression requires function
  |
help: if you meant to create this closure and immediately call it, surround the closure with parentheses
  |
2 |     println!("{}", (|| { 123 }) ());
  |                    +          +

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0618`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->
